sentences.english: The old basketball star walks gingerly on aching knees.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的籃球明星會因膝蓋的傷痛步履蹣跚。

sentences.english: The death of the boy caused great sadness to the mother.
sentences.chinese: 那男還孩的死給他母親帶來了巨大的傷痛。

sentences.english: Constant thrusts from your eyes keep my pain fresh for ever.
sentences.chinese: 你的眼神不斷地戳傷我，令我的傷痛永遠難癒合。

sentences.english: The method of microbial limit test for Guoyu Shangtongning Ointment was established.
sentences.chinese: 建立國玉傷痛寧軟膏的微生物限度檢查方法。

sentences.english: With sorrowfilled heart I walk ahead on my nightly patrol.
sentences.chinese: 拖着滿是傷痛的心，我繼續每天的夜巡。

sentences.english: And the wounds of a nation were healed.
sentences.chinese: 整個國家的傷痛終在這一刻癒合。

sentences.english: Through all of the pain and embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 通過所囿的傷痛與尷尬後。

sentences.english: WenYan resolution must hands-on assistance mother smooths the heart pain.
sentences.chinese: 文彥決議一定要親手協助母親撫平心裏的傷痛。

sentences.english: For David everything got worse before he was restored to the throne.
sentences.chinese: 大衛經歷了連番傷痛，最後才重掌王位。

sentences.english: Finally we can only display sadness and pain from tattoo guns Chers relentless.
sentences.chinese: 最後只能展現雪兒的自悲和傷痛無情。

sentences.english: And disappointed that the pain of separation, has been unable to the voice.
sentences.chinese: 那些離別和失望的傷痛，已經發不出聲音來了。

sentences.english: I love the beautiful crystal ah, I wish with all my pain for you and pay homage.
sentences.chinese: 我美麗的水晶之戀啊，我願用我所有的傷痛爲你祭奠。

sentences.english: The more that comes up, the more that can be healed and released.
sentences.chinese: 情感越被激發起來，傷痛就越能被治癒並釋放。

sentences.english: Although it is often stated time can cure emotional wound, my heart never seceded from blooding.
sentences.chinese: 都說時間能療治心靈的傷痛，卻我的心滴血不止。

sentences.english: It is friends who will always provide comfort when heart hurts .
sentences.chinese: 友誼是心裏之母，無平傷痛，慰籍心靈。

sentences.english: The remembrance rankles still in the bosoms of millions of the countrymen.
sentences.chinese: 傷痛的記憶仍然留在數百萬同胞的內心中。

definition: to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
in the end/after all is said and done
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
